results.idea: Cross-sectional momentum using 20-day returns zscore
results.description: Uses rsk62_5_return (high userCount=400) to compute short-medium momentum. Applied SUGGESTION1 partly (single main field chosen for robustness), SUGGESTION2 not applicable (field not vector), SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage=1.0), SUGGESTION4 applied (high userCount). Confidence: 0.78.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion: negative 5-day returns zscore
results.description: Mean-revert short-term moves using rsk62_5_return. Didnâ€™t use multiple datafields to keep implementation simple (SUGGESTION1 not applied). Coverage=1.0 so no ts_backfill. High userCount used. Confidence: 0.65.

results.idea: Volatility-adjusted momentum (returns / volatility) zscore
results.description: Combines returns and volatility to prefer high-risk-adjusted returns. Applied SUGGESTION1 (two fields), SUGGESTION4 (both fields have high userCounts). No ts_backfill required. Confidence: 0.74.

results.idea: Liquidity dampened momentum (returns scaled by logadv20)
results.description: Uses rsk62_5_return and rsk62_beta_5_100_logadv20 (liquidity proxy). SUGGESTION1 applied. Both have strong coverage/userCounts; no backfill. Confidence: 0.70.

results.idea: Size-neutral momentum (returns minus logcap effect)
results.description: Removes size exposure by subtracting logcap beta from returns. SUGGESTION1 applied; used beta_factor_1_100_logcap with high userCount. No ts_backfill. Confidence: 0.68.

results.idea: Earnings surprise momentum: recent eps date-index advantage
results.description: Uses rsk62_id_spe (earnings per share date index) to capture upcoming/ recent surprises combined with returns. SUGGESTION1 applied (2 fields); rsk62_id_spe has high userCount. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Factor interaction: factor_1 high recent returns amplified
results.description: Uses rsk62_factor_1_100_val100 (well-populated factor) with recent factor returns. Applied SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4; high coverage fields. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Vector-averaged industry momentum (vec_avg of industry retseries)
results.description: Identifies retseries field as vector and applies vec_avg per SUGGESTION2. Used rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val3 (coverage=1.0). SUGGESTION1 not expanded further to keep simplicity. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Industry mean reversion: current minus 5-day industry avg
results.description: Uses vector industry returns and short lookback difference. SUGGESTION2 applied (vec_avg). Coverage fine so no backfill. Confidence: 0.60.

results.idea: Momentum per unit idiosyncratic risk (returns / specific risk)
results.description: Penalize stocks with high specific risk using rsk62_1_100_ksrs (high userCount). SUGGESTION1 applied (2 fields). Coverage strong. Confidence: 0.72.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by net income per employee (quality tilt)
results.description: Combines returns and rsk62_risk_nipe (quality). SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied (rsk62_risk_nipe has high userCount). Confidence: 0.67.

results.idea: Low-volatility preference: negative volatility zscore
results.description: Prefer low-volatility securities via reversing volatility zscore. Single-field approach chosen for clarity (SUGGESTION1 not applied). Coverage high and userCount large. Confidence: 0.71.

results.idea: Momentum minus industry beta exposure
results.description: Neutralize industry beta by subtracting industry beta term (rsk62_beta_industry_constr_1_100_oil_gas). That field has coverage 0.6669 (>=0.6) so no backfill needed. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with gross margin quality overlay
results.description: Multiply returns by rsk62_risk_margin (gross margin) to favor profitable firms. SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied (risk_margin has good userCount). Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by current ratio (lower leverage risk)
results.description: Divide returns by rsk62_risk_curratio to penalize low liquidity companies. SUGGESTION1 used; curratio has high userCount. Confidence: 0.68.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after extreme retseries spike (vec_max)
results.description: Use vector retseries to detect spikes via vec_max and short those that spiked. Applied SUGGESTION2 (vec_max on retseries). Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Long-term momentum using long-term momentum index
results.description: Directly uses rsk62_id_mtl / rsk62_risk_mtl (high userCounts) to capture long-run trends. SUGGESTION1 applied; no backfill required. Confidence: 0.7.

results.idea: Short-term momentum with hump smoothing
results.description: Use hump to limit turnover on short momentum signals from returns. SUGGESTION1 minimal (one field) to keep turnover control. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum combined with dividend stability (tilt toward stable dividend firms)
results.description: Multiply returns with rsk62_risk_dividend to favor dividend-consistent names. SUGGESTION1 applied; dividend field has good userCount and coverage. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Relative industry outperformance using industry retseries vec_avg
results.description: Compute stock returns minus industry vec_avg(retseries) to pick industry leaders. SUGGESTION2 applied. Both fields coverage=1.0. Confidence: 0.67.

results.idea: Returns momentum adjusted by intercept (remove market intercept)
results.description: Subtract intercept term rsk62_1_100_intercept to remove common intercept effects. SUGGESTION1 applied; intercept has very high userCount. Confidence: 0.69.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by log(cap) (size tilt) using beta factor
results.description: Divide returns by beta to logcap (rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_logcap) to reduce large-cap bias. SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.65.

results.idea: Mean-reversion after volatility spike (returns vs volatility change)
results.description: Compare recent returns to recent volatility changes using ts_delta on volatility. SUGGESTION1 applied. Coverage high. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by net income per employee trend
results.description: Emphasize names where nipe is improving: use ts_returns(nipe) as weight. SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Industry relative momentum using factor retseries vec_avg
results.description: Use vec_avg on factor retseries to capture factor-driven industry moves (SUGGESTION2). Coverage ok. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by book-to-price (beta_pb) to prefer cheap momentum
results.description: Multiply returns by beta to pb (rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_pb) to tilt towards value-momentum. SUGGESTION1 applied; data coverage high. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after large vector-sum of factor returns (vec_sum)
results.description: Detect when combined factor returns have spiked via vec_sum on factor retseries and reverse. Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum combined with EPS growth (quality momentum overlay)
results.description: Multiply stock returns with rsk62_risk_growth (eps growth) to favor growing firms. SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.67.

results.idea: Momentum neutralized for industry by group_neutralize
results.description: Neutralize cross-sectional momentum by industry group effect using group_neutralize (keeps industry exposure out). SUGGESTION1 applied to avoid group-only use. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with turnover control via ts_decay_linear
results.description: Apply ts_decay_linear to momentum signal to smooth and target turnover. SUGGESTION1 minimal; kept operator count low. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum overweighting low book volatility using beta_factor_volatility
results.description: Divide returns by beta to volatility to prefer stable books. SUGGESTION1 applied; beta_factor_volatility has full coverage. Confidence: 0.68.

results.idea: Returns momentum minus expected industry returns (beta_5_100_industry)
results.description: Subtract expected industry returns (rsk62_beta_5_100_mtl) from stock returns to find stock-specific leaders. SUGGESTION1 applied. Coverage good. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by intercept variance (penalize high intercepts)
results.description: Divide returns by intercept magnitude to avoid stocks dominated by idiosyncratic intercepts. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum focused on high factor exposure (multiply by factor beta)
results.description: Multiply stock returns by beta to a strong factor (rsk62_beta_5_100_logadv20) to target factor-driven momentum. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Industry momentum rank (cross-sectional rank of vec_avg industry returns)
results.description: Rank industries by vec_avg of industry retseries and apply zscore cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum using factor retseries IR (information ratio)
results.description: Use ts_ir on factor retseries to favor factors with high IR and pick stocks exposed to them. SUGGESTION2 applied to treat retseries as vector; SUGGESTION1 limited. Confidence: 0.60.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by date-index of short-term momentum (id_mts)
results.description: Use rsk62_id_mts to filter/timing momentum signals. SUGGESTION1 applied; id_mts has high userCount. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum dampened for low adv20 backfilled (backfill then scale)
results.description: rsk62_risk_backfill_logadv20 available (coverage~0.9093); applied SUGGESTION3 to backfill if needed and SUGGESTION1 to combine fields. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Mean reversion using ts_arg_max on returns (if today's max in window -> revert)
results.description: Use ts_arg_max on returns to detect local peaks and reverse. SUGGESTION1 minimal; used a single reliable field. Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorized returns to limit outliers
results.description: Apply winsorize then zscore on returns to reduce outlier-driven signals. SUGGESTION1 limited to single field for simplicity. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by gross margin beta (beta_factor_margin)
results.description: Use rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_margin as a quality weight for returns. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied; field coverage high. Confidence: 0.65.

results.idea: Cross-sectional zscore of recent factor returns to allocate to factor-momentum
results.description: Use ts_zscore on factor returns rsk62_factor_5_100_val100 to pick factor leaders and place exposure. SUGGESTION1 applied to use factor and stock returns separately in practice. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum with book-value momentum overlay using id_pb changes
results.description: Combine stock returns with recent changes in book-value date index (rsk62_id_pb). SUGGESTION1 applied and id_pb has high userCount. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum neutralized by sector intercept (reduce sector bets)
results.description: Group-neutralize momentum by sector group to reduce sector concentration. SUGGESTION1 allowed group use as parameter. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum combined with net income trend backfilled
results.description: Use rsk62_risk_backfill_nipe to handle missing nipe (SUGGESTION3) then combine with returns. SUGGESTION4 applied (nipe high userCount). Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Return momentum adjusted by beta to growth (remove growth exposure)
results.description: Subtract beta to growth (rsk62_beta_1_100_growth) from returns to avoid pure growth exposure. SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Trend-following signal using ts_product of recent returns
results.description: Use ts_product to detect consistent direction across days (SUGGESTION1 single field). Coverage high. Confidence: 0.60.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by market-cap intercept proxy (risk_logcap)
results.description: Divide returns by rsk62_risk_logcap to penalize cap-driven moves. SUGGESTION1 used. Coverage good. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with return kurtosis filter (avoid fat-tail stocks)
results.description: Use ts_kurtosis on returns to penalize high-kurtosis stocks. SUGGESTION1 applied; operator available. Confidence: 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by days_from_last_change in earnings date-index
results.description: Favor names with recent earnings changes using days_from_last_change(rsk62_id_spe). SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for expected industry returns using beta_5 data
results.description: Subtract industry expected returns rsk62_beta_5_100_electric to isolate stock-specific momentum. Coverage >0.6 so no backfill. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_quantile to normalize across instruments
results.description: Apply ts_quantile to returns to produce Gaussian-normalized signal; helps comparability. SUGGESTION1 single field used. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum combined with margin improvement (backfilled margin)
results.description: Use rsk62_risk_backfill_margin (SUGGESTION3) to handle missing gross margin, then combine. SUGGESTION4 applied due to margin userCount. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum divided by long-term momentum beta to avoid overlapping signals
results.description: Normalize short returns versus long-term momentum exposure rsk62_beta_1_100_mtl. SUGGESTION1 applied; coverage strong. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum with zscore of factor exposure cross-sectionally
results.description: Compute zscore of a stock's factor exposure (rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_pb) and combine multiplicatively with returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum following factor momentum (apply factor retseries IR as filter)
results.description: Use ts_ir on factor retseries as a filter; if factor IR high, trade momentum. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence: 0.60.

results.idea: Momentum amplified by intercept growth (use intercept val changes)
results.description: Use ts_delta on rsk62_1_100_intercept to amplify names with rising intercepts. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorized industry avg subtraction
results.description: Subtract winsorized vec_avg of industry retseries to reduce outlier industry effects (SUGGESTION2 and winsorize). Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Short-term momentum scaled by short-term momentum beta
results.description: Divide short returns by rsk62_beta_1_100_mts to avoid trading high short-term momentum beta stocks. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum combined with log(adv20) date-index to time liquidity
results.description: Weight momentum by recent changes in logadv20 (rsk62_logadv20_di) to favor improving liquidity. SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Medium-term reversal using ts_rank over 60 days
results.description: Rank 60-day returns cross-sectionally and reverse top decile to capture mean reversion. SUGGESTION1 used minimally. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by count of NaNs in retseries (robustness filter)
results.description: Use ts_count_nans on retseries to avoid low-quality signals (SUGGESTION2 for retseries). Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for beta to EPS (penalize earnings-sensitive names)
results.description: Subtract rsk62_beta_1_100_spe from returns to reduce earnings-sensitive exposure. SUGGESTION1 applied; field coverage full. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_scale normalization to [0,1]
results.description: Use ts_scale to time-normalize returns before cross-sectional ranking. SUGGESTION1 used single field for clarity. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum combined with net income per employee risk (rsk62_risk_nipe)
results.description: Multiply returns by rsk62_risk_nipe to favor firms with stronger nipe. SUGGESTION1 & SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum modulated by beta to margin improvements
results.description: Weight returns by rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_margin capturing margin exposure. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_percentile (ts_quantile gaussian) normalization
results.description: Apply ts_quantile to returns to obtain Gaussian-normalized signal; helps cross-time stability. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by industry-specific beta backfilled
results.description: Use ts_backfill for low-coverage industry beta (if coverage<0.6) then adjust returns. Applied SUGGESTION3 where needed. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with group-scale within industry (reduce within-group dispersion)
results.description: Use group_scale to normalize momentum within industry groups. KEEP_IN_MIND4 satisfied (group used as parameter). Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_ir (information ratio) of returns
results.description: Compute short-run IR of returns to favor consistent performers. SUGGESTION1 single-field approach. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum multiplied by earnings-per-share date stability
results.description: Use rsk62_risk_spe and its recent changes to weight momentum. SUGGESTION1 applied; spe has good userCount. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_av_diff to highlight deviation from historical mean
results.description: Use ts_av_diff of returns to measure deviation from past mean and trade on it. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Multi-factor momentum: combine two independent factor returns multiplicatively
results.description: Multiply short returns with a stable factor (rsk62_factor_1_100_val100). SUGGESTION1 applied (two fields). Both have high coverage. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum penalized by industry beta constraint with backfill if needed
results.description: Use ts_backfill for industry beta fields with coverage slightly below threshold, then penalize returns. SUGGESTION3 applied where coverage<0.6. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum combined with retseries kurtosis to avoid fat-tail industries
results.description: Compute ts_kurtosis on industry retseries (vec field) and penalize stocks. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence: 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_delay to avoid recent reversals (lagged signal)
results.description: Use lagged returns (ts_delay) to avoid immediacy bias and reduce noise. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum combined with log(adv20) exposure (beta) favoring liquid names
results.description: Multiply returns by rsk62_beta_5_100_logadv20 to bias liquid stocks. SUGGESTION1 applied and data robust. Confidence: 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_std_dev filter to avoid noisy stocks
results.description: Filter out names with very high ts_std_dev of returns. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for dividend beta (penalize low dividend stability)
results.description: Use rsk62_beta_5_100_dividend to adjust returns; dividend beta has high userCount so SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum combined with factor intercept (favor factor-aligned momentum)
results.description: Multiply returns by factor intercept rsk62_factor_5_100_intercept to lean into factor-driven momentum. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_arg_min to detect local troughs for long entry
results.description: Use ts_arg_min on returns to find local minima and go long (mean-reversion entry). SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence: 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by net income per employee backfilled
results.description: Use ts_backfill on nipe when necessary (SUGGESTION3) and multiply with returns. Applied SUGGESTION4 (high nipe userCount). Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorize on beta to reduce skew from extremes
results.description: Winsorize beta_factor_1_100_logadv20 and divide returns by it to avoid extreme liquidity weights. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum combined with factor 1 recent zscore cross-sectionally
results.description: Use zscore of factor_1 returns and multiply with stock returns to favor factor-aligned names. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum using ts_rank with constant shift for stability
results.description: Compute ts_rank of returns with a constant to stabilize ranks over time. SUGGESTION1 single-field applied. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by beta to food industry backfilled
results.description: For low-coverage industry beta fields, apply ts_backfill then subtract from returns (SUGGESTION3 applied). Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with group_mean within sector (smooth within group)
results.description: Apply group_mean to momentum per sector to reduce idiosyncratic noise. Uses group as parameter per KEEP_IN_MIND4. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum amplified by improving gross margin trend
results.description: Multiply returns by ts_delta(rsk62_margin_di) to favor improving-margin firms. SUGGESTION1 applied and margin_di has good userCount. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_decay_linear targeting specific turnover
results.description: Apply ts_target_tvr_decay wrapper to momentum to target turnover (operator available). Keeps signal practical. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum with factor exposure cap (tail operator)
results.description: Use tail to cap extreme factor exposures (protect against outliers) and then compute zscore. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum modulated by beta to semiconductors (industry-specific)
results.description: Subtract semiconductor industry beta rsk62_beta_5_100_semiconductors to isolate stock skill in that industry. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum emphasis on stocks with improving dividend date-index
results.description: Use ts_delta(rsk62_dividend_di) to weigh momentum toward firms increasing dividend regularity. SUGGESTION1 applied and dividend_di has high userCount. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum with group_zscore (within industry zscore)
results.description: Compute zscore within group using group_zscore to remove industry mean and std effects. KEEP_IN_MIND4 respected. Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by low count of NaNs in betas (quality filter)
results.description: Use ts_count_nans on beta_factor_5_100_logadv20 to filter low-quality betas then trade momentum. SUGGESTION3 applied where backfill desirable. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum using vec_stddev of factor retseries to penalize unstable factors
results.description: Compute vec_stddev on factor retseries (SUGGESTION2) and penalize names exposed to volatile factors. Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum combined with pb improvement (book value momentum)
results.description: Multiply returns by ts_delta(rsk62_id_pb) to favor improving book metrics. SUGGESTION1 applied; id_pb has high userCount. Confidence: 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum penalized by beta to telecommunications (limit telecom exposure)
results.description: Subtract rsk62_beta_1_100_telecommunications from returns to reduce telecom concentration. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with winsorized vec_sum of industry retseries to avoid sector bubbles
results.description: Compute vec_sum on industry retseries then winsorize to avoid taking large sector-wide bets (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum with trade_when to avoid trading around big events (earnings)
results.description: Use trade_when to close positions if earnings date-index indicates imminent event (rsk62_id_spe). SUGGESTION1 applied and id_spe robust. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum combined with factor 1 recent returns average (vec_avg on factor retseries)
results.description: Apply vec_avg on factor retseries to get factor momentum and multiply with stock returns (SUGGESTION2 & SUGGESTION1). Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum with group_count filter (only trade where group coverage strong)
results.description: Use group_count to ensure enough instruments in industry group before trading momentum per industry. KEEP_IN_MIND4 respected. Confidence: 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum dampened by beta to electronics (avoid electronics cycles)
results.description: Subtract electronics industry beta rsk62_beta_1_100_electronics from returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by improving net income per employee backfilled
results.description: Use ts_backfill on nipe when needed then multiply with stock returns as quality weight (SUGGESTION3 & 4 applied). Confidence: 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum using signed_power to emphasize positive wins
results.description: Apply signed_power to returns to accentuate strong positive momentum while preserving sign. SUGGESTION1 single-field. Confidence: 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum normalized by group_sum to avoid oversized groups
results.description: Divide returns signal by group_sum to reduce over-allocation to dense industries. KEEP_IN_MIND4 observed. Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by low coverage industry betas with backfill
results.description: For low-coverage industry beta fields (coverage<0.6), apply ts_backfill and then use as filter for momentum. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum with ts_delay on factor retseries average
results.description: Delay vec_avg of factor retseries then multiply with returns to avoid immediate factor reversals (SUGGESTION2). Confidence: 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum combined with improving log(cap) date-index
results.description: Use ts_delta on rsk62_logcap_di to favor firms with rising market caps paired with momentum. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum attenuated by group_std_dev (avoid groups with volatile signals)
results.description: Divide momentum by group_std_dev to reduce allocation to unstable industries. KEEP_IN_MIND4 observed. Confidence: 0.6.
